Posts.Content: On Jan 23, 2018 5:14 AM CindyOR wrote: Hello Everyone, I was diagnosed with stage 2 breast cancer 2 months ago. I will do my 4th round of chemotherapy this week. I have noticed the lump has shrunk quite a bit and would not be surprised if it goes away by this next round. I am planning to discuss with my doctor if we may decrease the rounds, she wanted to add another drug to my last 4 rounds but I don't think this is necessary. I know they want to get rid of it but I am worried about the long term damage. I also have been reading the posts on here about the side effects of radiation and surgery which is making me worried as well. All my doctors tell me is that there will be fatigue and a sunburn...I am not sure how much I need but they say lumpectomy and 4-6 weeks of radiation every day, it will be aimed directly at the tumor and not the whole breast. Any tips on how to make sure we aren't overdoing it and causing more harm than good? i have had chemo and radiation together. i was told i could get a possible "sun burn" on the area where they did the radiation. i went 5 days a week for 6 weeks never got anything in that area but the tumor did shrink so i could have surgery. i had stage 3a colon cancer i am now 2yrs cancer free.. the radiation is in such small amounts so i think you should at least give it a try.
Posts.Title: Radiation and chemo amounts
